p: Dihydroethidium (DHE, Life Technologies) was used to detect overproduction of the superoxide anion (O 2• −) [ 57]. DHE (2 µM final concentration, incubation: 15 min, 37 °C) is rapidly oxidized in the cells in ethidium by reactive oxygen species, mainly O 2• − [ 58]. The fluorescent signals were collected through a 590/20 nm bandpass filter on a logarithmic scale on a GALAXY flow cytometer (Partec); 10,000 cells were acquired. Flomax (Partec) or Flowjo (Tree Star Inc., Ashland, OR, USA) was used to analyze the data.
